title: Introduction to Computing
description: Introduction to the field of computer science. Overview of computer hardware, software, programming languages, data structures, algorithms, and applications of computing.

title: Programming Fundamentals I
description: Introduction to computer programming with emphasis on systematic program design, problem-solving methods, and algorithm development using a structured, high-level programming language.

title: Programming Fundamentals II
description: Continuation of Programming Fundamentals I. Advanced programming concepts including data structures, file processing, recursion, and object-oriented programming principles.

title: Data Structures and Algorithms I
description: Introduction to the analysis of algorithms and their associated data structures. Topics include stacks, queues, lists, trees, sorting, and searching algorithms.

title: Data Structures and Algorithms II
description: Advanced data structures and algorithm analysis. Topics include graphs, advanced sorting algorithms, dynamic programming, and algorithm complexity analysis.

title: Database Systems
description: Introduction to database systems including conceptual design, logical design, and physical design of databases. Topics include ER modeling, normalization, SQL, and transaction processing.

title: Operating Systems
description: Principles of operating system design and implementation. Topics include process management, memory management, file systems, and concurrency control.

title: Software Engineering
description: Principles and practices of software engineering including requirements analysis, design methodologies, implementation strategies, testing, and project management.

title: Computer Networks
description: Introduction to computer networks and data communications. Topics include network protocols, network architectures, and network security.

title: Machine Learning
description: Introduction to machine learning algorithms and techniques. Topics include supervised learning, unsupervised learning, neural networks, and deep learning.
